pageTitle: London Underground Service Update - Metronet Strike Suspended

title.title: London Underground Service Update - Metronet Strike Suspended

texts:
A TfL spokesperson said:
"We are pleased that the RMT has suspended its strike action at Metronet, following the clarification of all jobs and pensions issues.

"We will now work to provide the best possible Tube service on Wednesday. However, as the strike was suspended so late this evening, it will take time for us to restore a full service on all Underground lines today.
"Passengers should check before they travel to see how Tube services are running. Our staff will be available to provide travel advice and assistance on Wednesday."
The latest service update on all lines can be found at live travel news .
Passengers can check before travelling via the following options:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["The \u003ca href=\"http://www.tfl.gov.uk/\"\u003eTfL website\u003c/a\u003e ;","The London Travel Info 24hrs telephone helpline: 020 7222 1234;","BBC Ceefax, page 436, or ITV's Teletext, page 164; and","Information on posters at stations and information boards at Tube stations."]}
